member.name: T:NuGet.Common.ActivityCorrelationId
member.summary: Ambient correlation ID used to associate information pertaining to a current activity. A single activity engages multiple method calls at different layers. Sometimes it's necessary to identify separate calls belonging to the same activity if shared state is needed.

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.ActivityCorrelationId.Current
member.summary: Returns current activity correlation ID or a default if not set previously.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.ActivityCorrelationId.StartNew
member.summary: Starts a new activity activity correlation ID by updating ambient context value.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AggregateEnumerableAsync`1
member.summary: Aggregates from a list of already ordered enumerables The ordered result will contain only unique values If comparer/EqualityComparer are not provided the default ones for that type will be used. If the provided enumerables are not sorted already, the behavior is undefined

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AggregateEnumeratorAsync`1
member.summary: Aggregates from a list of already ordered enumerables The ordered result will contain only unique values If comparer/EqualityComparer are not provided the default ones for that type will be used. If the provided enumerables are not sorted already, the behavior is undefined

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.IEnumeratorAsync`1
member.summary: Supports async iteration over a generic collection. Prior to calling Current, MoveNextAsync needs to be called otherwise the behavior is undefined
member.typeparam: The type of objects to enumerate.This type parameter is covariant. That is, you can use either the type you specified or any type that is more derived. For more information about covariance and contravariance, see Covariance and Contravariance in Generics.

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.IEnumeratorAsync`1.Current
member.summary: Gets the element in the collection at the current position of the enumerator. If MoveNextAsync has not been called prior to calling current the behavior is undefined If the last MoveNextAsync call returned false then the next call to Current should throw an InvalidOperationException
member.returns: The element in the collection at the current position of the enumerator.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.IEnumeratorAsync`1.MoveNextAsync
member.summary: Moves the pointer to the next element in the collection.
member.returns: Success status of the pointer move

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AsyncLazy`1
member.summary: Wrapper class representing shorter syntax of Lazy<Task<T>>"/>. Useful when declaring a lazy async factory of value T.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AsyncLazy
member.summary: Shortcuts to common Lazy<Task<T>> constructor calls

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AuthTypeFilteredCredentials
member.summary: Wraps a NetworkCredentials object by returning null if the authType is not in a specified allow list

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.AuthTypeFilteredCredentials.#ctor(System.Net.NetworkCredential,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new AuthTypeFilteredCredentials
member.param: List of authTypes to respond to. If empty, responds to all authTypes.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.ClientVersionUtility.GetNuGetAssemblyVersion
member.summary: Find the current NuGet client version from the assembly info as a string. If no value can be found an InvalidOperationException will be thrown.
member.remarks: This can contain prerelease labels if AssemblyInformationalVersionAttribute exists.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider
member.summary: CryptoHashProvider helps calculate or verify hash based on SHA256 or SHA512 algorithms

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.SHA512HashAlgorithm
member.summary: Server token used to represent that the hash being used is SHA 512

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.SHA256HashAlgorithm
member.summary: Server token used to represent that the hash being used is SHA 256

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of CryptoHashProvider. Since the algorithm is not specified, SHA512 is assumed

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of CryptoHashProvider using the hashAlgorithm

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.CalculateHash(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Calculates the hash for a given stream

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.CalculateHash(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calculates the hash for a byte array

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashProvider.VerifyHash(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the hash for the given data and hash

member.summary: Compute the hash as a base64 encoded string.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashUtility.ComputeHashAsBase64(System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm,System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compute the hash as a base64 encoded string.
member.param: If false the stream will be closed.
member.returns: A base64 encoded hash string.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashUtility.ComputeHash(NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Compute the hash as a byte[].

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashUtility.ComputeHash(System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Compute the hash as a byte[].
member.returns: A hash byte[].

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashUtility.ComputeHash(System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm,System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compute the hash as a byte[].
member.param: If false the stream will be closed.
member.returns: A hash byte[].

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashUtility.ReadFipsConfigValue
member.summary: Determines if we are to only allow Fips compliant algorithms.
member.remarks: CryptoConfig.AllowOnlyFipsAlgorithm does not exist in Mono.

member.summary: Extension method to convert NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName to an Oid string
member.returns: Oid string equivalent of the NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName

member.summary: Extension method to convert NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName to an OID
member.returns: OID equivalent of the NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.CryptoHashUtility.OidToHashAlgorithmName(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to convert an Oid string to NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName
member.returns: NuGet.Common.HashAlgorithmName equivalent of the oid string

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.LogMessage
member.summary: Basic log message.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode
member.summary: This enum is used to quantify NuGet error and warning codes.
member.remarks:
Format - NUxyzw where NU is the prefix indicating NuGet and xyzw is a 4 digit code
Numbers - xyzw x - 'x' is the largest digit and should be used to quantify a set of errors. For example 1yzw are set of restore related errors and no other code path should use the range 1000 to 1999 for errors or warnings.
y - 'y' is the second largest digit and should be used for sub sections withing a broad category.
For example 12zw cvould be http related errors. Further 'y' = 0-4 should be used for errors and 'y' = 5-9 should be warnings.
zw - 'zw' are the least two digit. These could be used for different errors or warnings within the broad categories set by digits 'xy'.
Groups: 1000-1999 - Restore 3000-3999 - Signing 5000-5999 - Packaging
Sub groups for Restore: error/warning - Reason 1000/1500 - Input 1100/1600 - Resolver 1200/1700 - Compat 1300/1800 - Feed 1400/1900 - Package
All new codes need a corresponding MarkDown file under https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/tree/master/docs/reference/errors-and-warnings.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.Undefined
member.summary: Do not display the code.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1000
member.summary: Undefined error

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1001
member.summary: Project has zero target frameworks.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1002
member.summary: Invalid combination with CLEAR

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1003
member.summary: Invalid combination of PTF and ATF

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1004
member.summary: Locked mode, but restore needs to update the lock file.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1005
member.summary: Invalid combination of RestorePackagesWithLockFile and packages.lock.json file.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1006
member.summary: NuGet configuration file has an invalid package source value.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1007
member.summary: Project provided runtime graph is invalid. Either does not exist or cannot be parsed.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1008
member.summary: Projects that use central package version management should not define the version on the PackageReference items but on the PackageVersion items.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.NU1009
member.summary: Projects that use central package version management should not define SDK implicit referenced packages. For more information, see https://aka.ms/sdkimplicitrefs

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.WarningLevel
member.summary:
These are Warning Levels used by NuGet while throwing warnings. These logically correspond to .NET spec at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/13b90fz7(v=vs.140).aspx
We do not have a level 0 as that has no logical meaning of having a warning with level 0.
Severe - This should be used to throw warnings that are just short of being an error.
Important - Lower level than severe.
Minimal - Lower level than important.
Default - Lowest level of warnings. Default NuGet logging will ignore these warnings.

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.ExceptionLogger.ShowStack
member.summary: Determines whether the full exception (including stack trace) should be displayed to the user. In prerelease or dogfooding scenarios, it is useful to have a non-verbose logging level but, in the case of an unhandled exception, print the full exception for bug reporting.
member.returns: True if the exception stack should be displayed to the user. False, otherwise.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.SignatureValidationMode.Accept
member.summary: Relaxed signature verification mode. Allows unsigned packages, and issues are treated as warnings.

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.SignatureValidationMode.Require
member.summary: Strict signature verification mode. All packages most be signed. Any issue is an error and allow list of trusted signers must be provided.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An absolute path is required: '{0}'..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Value must be greater than or equal to {0}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Required environment variable '{0}' is not set. Try setting '{0}' and running the operation again..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Required environment variable '{0}' is not set. Try setting '{1}' or '{0}' and running the operation.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to At least one package folder path must be provided..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.PackageFolderNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Package folder not found: '{0}'..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnableToDetemineClientVersion
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to determine the current NuGet client version..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnauthorizedLockFail
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to obtain lock file access on '{0}' for operations on '{1}'. This may mean that a different user or administrator is holding this lock and that this process does not have permission to access it. If no other process is currently performing an operation on this file it may mean that an earlier NuGet process crashed and left an inaccessible lock file, in this case removing the file '{0}' will allow NuGet to continue..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnsupportedHashAlgorithm
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Hash algorithm '{0}' is unsupported. Supported algorithms include: SHA512 and SHA256..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnsupportedHashAlgorithmName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Hash algorithm '{0}' is unsupported..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnsupportedSignatureAlgorithmName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Signature algorithm '{0}' is unsupported..

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.Tokenizer
member.summary:
This class is used to parse string into tokens. There are two types of tokens: variables, e.g. "$variable$", or text. The dollar sign can be escaped using $$. A variable contains only word characters.
Examples: - "a $b$ c" is parsed into {text, "a "}, {variable, "b"}, {text, " c"}. - "a $$b$$ c" is parsed into {text, "a $b$ c"}. - "a $b$ $c" is parsed into {text, "a "}, {variable, "b"}, {text, " $c"}. - "a $b$$c$" is parsed into {text, "a "}, {variable, "b"}, {variable, "c"}. - "a $b c$d$" is parsed into {text, "a $b c"}, {variable, "d"} (because space is not a word character).

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.Tokenizer.Read
member.summary: Gets the next token.
member.returns: The parsed token. Or null if no more tokens are available.
